properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 5 at 4:00AM CST until February 6 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Quad Cities IA IL
properties.description:
...Accumulating Snow This Afternoon Into Thursday...

.A storm system moving north out of the lower Mississippi River
Valley and up across the Ohio River Valley will bring
accumulating snow of 2 to 4 inches to portions of the area
this afternoon through Thursday morning. The higher snow amounts
are expected east of the Mississippi River. This snow will be an
impact on both the Wednesday evening and Thursday morning
commutes.

* WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4
inches.

* WHERE...Portions of northeast Missouri, southeast Iowa and
north central, northwest and west central Illinois. The higher
snow amounts are expected east of the Mississippi River.

* WHEN...From noon Wednesday to noon CST Thursday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. A period or two of
moderate snowfall may reduce visibilities to less than one mile
at times. The hazardous conditions could impact both the evening
commute today and the morning commute Thursday.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

In Illinois, go to www.gettingaroundillinois.com for road
conditions.
In Iowa, call 511 for road conditions.
In Missouri, call 800-222-6400 for road conditions.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO NOON CST THURSDAY
